title: The Rust-Worms' Feast
description: A swarm of 'Rust-Worms' has invaded the central granary. They don't eat grain; they eat the silos.

turns.narrative: The granary is a massive complex of corrugated iron silos. The 'Rust-Worms' are three-foot-long, segmented monstrosities with saws for mouths. They are chewing through the thick metal like it's paper.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You spot a 'Prime-Worm' with a golden carapace. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You slow their feast significantly. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A silo collapses, spilling tons of 'Spark-Grain' across the floor.

turns.narrative: The Spark-Grain is highly flammable. The Rust-Worms' chewing is creating friction and sparks. The air is a powder-keg.
turns.choice_a: Dampen the grain with foam (Dex DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You prevent an explosion. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Lure the worms away with iron-scraps
turns.consequence_b: Success: The majority of the swarm follows the 'Easy Meal'. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Prime-Worm roars, a sound like a circular saw hitting a nail, and charges you.

turns.narrative: The Prime-Worm's saw-mouth is spinning at thousands of RPM. It's aiming for your legs.
turns.choice_a: Jump and strike from above (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You land on its back, avoiding the saws. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Parry with a heavy shield (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You hold your ground, but your shield is badly scarred. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Prime-Worm retreats into a grain-pile, its golden shell glowing with a manic energy.

turns.narrative: You're waist-deep in the Spark-Grain. You can feel the worms moving beneath the surface like sharks.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You force the worms to the surface. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You anticipate the next ambush. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: A hidden vent opens, and a 'Grain-Watcher'—a robotic scarecrow—steps into the room.

turns.narrative: The Grain-Watcher is malfunctioning, firing 'Harpoon-Bolts' at anything that moves—including you.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You turn its weapons on the worms. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The worms are being thinned out, but the Prime-Worm is now twice its original size.

turns.narrative: The Prime-Worm has eaten the Watcher's battery. It's now trailing lightning alongside its saws.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You ignore the electrical shocks. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Ground the worm with a copper-spike (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You cause a massive short-circuit in its body. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Prime-Worm explodes in a shower of sparks and iron-filings.

turns.narrative: The swarm scatters with the death of their leader. The granary is a mess of spilled grain and mangled metal.
turns.choice_a: Help the workers salvage the grain (Endurance DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You save 60% of the winter supply. (+5 Morale)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Gold-Obsidian Curio' (Value: 300g). (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Granary-Manager arrives, offering you a 'Life-Long Voucher' for bread.

turns.narrative: The Manager reveals the worms weren't natural—they were 'Engineered' to target this specific granary.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You trace the worms back to the 'Warp-Docks'. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Search the ruins for a 'Control-Disk' (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a small, buzzing device in the debris. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: You hand the evidence to the local Magistrate.

turns.narrative: The Magistrate rewards you with a 'Defender's Medal' and a bag of 'Spark-Rice'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are now a recognized protector of the food supply. (+5 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Decline and ask for the Prime-Worm's heart
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Saw-Heart Engine'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The granary is reinforced with stone walls to prevent future attacks.

turns.narrative: The smell of fresh bread from the saved grain fills the air. It's the smell of survival.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You feel remarkably healthy. (+1 Luck)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You increase local security. (+1 Rep)

conclusion: The Rust-Worms' feast was stopped, but the sabotage suggests a 'Food-War' is brewing between the wards.

risk_matrix.penalty: Silos destroyed. -10 Resources and bread prices double for a month.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

permanent_effects.settlement: Granary reinforced; food sabotage conspiracy opened
